attributes.action: Remove the “mandatory £210 test to do” after returning in UK from abroad
attributes.additional_details: It is unconstitutional to force anyone to pay 210£ for a test which can be cheaper if bought somewhere else. If you want me to do the test and the test is negative, then I do not have to quarantine.
attributes.background: The government cannot force anyone to pay 210£ for a test to be done at home and force anyway them to stay in quarantine, make no sense

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Review testing and self-isolation requirements for arrivals to England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568602

Lower the price of the £210 COVID Home Test Kits for travellers entering the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575509

Fund free hotel quarantine and testing for all UK arrivals: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575118

Do not enforce mandatory hotel quarantines for international arrivals: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571682
